channel.title: Survey - VPS Hosting Interest
channel.description:
Hi there!
I am considering starting up VPS hosting company, and am asking for feedback.
Firstly a few notes about the setup:
- The servers would be UK based, racked in a state of the art datacenter, such as bluesquare.
- We would pimarily be offering linux VPS services based on the xen kernel with hypervm panel support, however aim to provide windows services aswell in the future.
- Each server would have a minimum spec of: Intel quad core 2.4ghz 4gb DDR2 800mhz 500gb sata-300 in a RAID1 config 100mb full duplex internet connection
Some general proposed packages and prices are:
128mb ram - 5gb disk - 150gb transfer - £5 256mb ram - 15gb disk - 300gb transfer - £10 384mb ram - 25gb disk - 600gb transfer - £13 512mb ram - 35gb disk - 800gb transger - £18 - And so on.
Would you find these prices acceptable, would you pay more? or prefer it cheaper?
The usual options and extras would be available such as a range of linux distros to choose from, cpanel, extra ip addresses, free unlimited reboots & reformats etc.
Bluntly, what I'd like to know is, if you were presented with these facts and a decent looking website, would you go for it? and how much would you be prepared to pay?
Thanks for your time, feedback is gratefully received.
- Chris.

item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:28, topic:216801”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=284978.msg2311075#msg2311075 date=1215054484]
or 1000 GB
[/quote]
More like 1024gb.[/quote]
But OSes only see 968GB of it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @RHS100 RHS100
item.description:
@RHS100 wrote:

[quote=“deoxys505, post:25, topic:216801”]those seem fair. Keep the minimum at 128mb (for people who want basic hosting), and upgrade the last to +512

128mb ram - 7gb disk - 100gb transfer - £7.00 - monthly
256mb ram - 15gb disk - 300gb transfer - £12.00 - monthly
512mb ram - 35gb disk - 800gb transfer - £17.00 - monthly
1gb ram - 50gb disk - 1.1tb transfer - £21.50 - monthly
1.5gb ram - 65gb disk - 1.5tb transfer - £24.50 - monthly
2gb ram - 80gb disk - 2tb transfer - £28.00 - monthly
2.5gb ram - 100gb disk - 3tb transfer - £33.00 - monthly

Then maybe better packages like pk4pk meant.

Bronze package

Silver package

Gold package

Platnium package
----------------[/quote]
also keeping it at 128mb ram gives them a reason to upgrade. Also after each upgrade add about 5mb of extra ram

Read full topic

item.title: Survey - VPS Hosting Interest
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“USMC, post:22, topic:216801”]What is TB?[/quote]1 TB = 1 Terabyte = 10^12 Bytes

en.wikipedia.org

Terabyte

The terabyte is a multiple of the unit byte for digital information. The prefix tera represents the fourth power of 1000, and means 1012 in the International System of Units (SI), and therefore one terabyte is one trillion (short scale) bytes. The unit symbol for the terabyte is TB. 1 TB = 1000000000000bytes = 1012bytes = 1000gigabytes. A related unit, the tebibyte (TiB), using a binary prefix, is equal to 10244 bytes. One terabyte is about 0.9095 TiB. Despite the introduction of these standard...

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @RHS100 RHS100
item.description:
@RHS100 wrote:

@topic
dont lower the minimum ram to 256 keep it at 128, give people a reason to upgrade.

Also you might want to look at a cheap outsourced support company to help provide faster support.

item.title: Survey - VPS Hosting Interest
item.dc:creator: @USMC USMC
item.description:
@USMC wrote:

ZeroFreeze:

Those are fair prices. Will cpanel be included free?

unfortunately cpanel won’t be included free as there is no ‘per server’ reusable licence.
On the upside, we will be able to offer discounted licences especially designed for VPS, they will be priced at £8 monthly with optional free installation.

And franK_, yes the server hardware does matter, obviously an identical package woud perform better on a quad core than an hold intel 468, heh?

Read full topic

[/quote]

item.title: Survey - VPS Hosting Interest
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:14, topic:216801”][quote author=RHS100 link=topic=284978.msg2309779#msg2309779 date=1214996941]

why would anyone care what the specs of the machine are when you are giving them a vps

so they know what the server they was hosted on was like?
[/quote]it doesnt matter, though[/quote]
Actually it does. The more powerfull the host machine, the more CPU each VPS has. Therefore faster.
